text: At 120 °C and 1 atm pressure, 1.00 L of methane, CH4, reacts completely with excess oxygen to form carbon dioxide and water. What volumes of the two products are produced at this pressure and temperature?
Polypropylene is made by polymerizing propene, C3H6 (M = 42.1). How many molecules of propene must be polymerized to make 3.50 g polypropylene?
An organic compound contains only carbon, hydrogen, nitrogen, and oxygen. It is 61.71% C, 4.03% H, and 16.00% N by mass. What is its empirical formula?
100.0 mL of 0.500 M CaBr2 and 50.0 mL of 1.00 M NaBr are mixed. What is the concentration of bromide ion in the resulting solution?
What is the value of n?

options.D:
2.0

text: The concentration of an aqueous solution of a nonvolatile, monoprotic acid is measured first by freezing point depression and then by boiling point elevation. The solution is found to be 0.93 m by freezing point depression and to be 0.82 m by boiling point elevation. Which is the best explanation for this discrepancy?

options.A: Ionization of the acid is markedly exothermic.
options.B: The solute associates partially into dimers at lower temperatures.
options.C: The volume of the solution is greater at higher temperatures.
options.D: The boiling point elevation constant for water is smaller than its freezing point depression constant.

text: When substances are separated by fractional distillation, which property is least typical of the substance that distills first?
Which element is most abundant (by mass) in the Earth’s crust?
Which gas has the highest molar solubility in water at 25 °C and 1 atm?
Which compound is colorless?
Chlorine gas is bubbled into a colorless aqueous solution of sodium iodide. Which is the best description of what takes place?

options.A: A precipitate of white NaCl forms.
options.B: A precipitate of metallic Na forms.
options.C: The solution turns pale green as the chlorine dissolves.
options.D: The solution turns yellow-brown as iodide reacts with the chlorine.

text: A student determines the number of moles of water in a hydrated metal oxide by weighing a clean, dry crucible and lid while the crucible is empty, then reweighing the crucible and lid with a sample of the hydrate, heating the crucible and lid with a Bunsen burner and then reweighing the crucible and lid with the sample after cooling to room temperature. Which error will result in too high a value for the amount of water of hydration?

options.A: The heating is conducted only once instead of the three times recommended by the procedure.
options.B: The lid is left off the crucible when it is weighed with the hydrated oxide.
options.C: The metal oxide reacts partially with oxygen in the air, forming a compound in a higher oxidation state.
options.D: Some of the heated oxide is spilled from the crucible before it can be weighed.

text: The diagram is a microscopic view of a snapshot of a substance at equilibrium, with the circles representing molecules and the arrows the molecules’ velocities. What state of matter is depicted?
The vapor density of which fluorocarbon is 6.17 g L–1 at 23 °C and 1.00 atm?
What is the principal intermolecular force that must be overcome when n-hexane (C6H14, bp = 69 °C) is vaporized?
The melting point of water decreases with increasing pressure. Which is the best explanation for this observation?

options.A: Liquid water is denser than solid water at 0 °C.
options.B: Melting of ice is endothermic at 0 °C.
options.C: The vapor pressure of liquid water is lower than the vapor pressure of solid water at 0 °C.
options.D: Solid and liquid water cannot coexist at equilibrium at 0 °C at pressures different from 1 atm.

text: A cylinder containing a mixture of CO and CO2 has a pressure of 2.00 atm at 93 °C (366 K). The cylinder is then cooled to –90 °C (183 K), where CO is still a gas but CO2 is a solid with a vapor pressure of 0.25 atm. The pressure in the cylinder at this temperature is 0.90 atm. What is the mole fraction of CO2 in the cylinder?

options.D: It cannot be determined from the information given.

text: A mineral containing only copper and oxygen adopts the cubic unit cell shown below. What is the formula of this mineral?
Burning 48.0 g of graphite in excess oxygen under standard conditions releases 1574.0 kJ of heat. What is ∆H°f of CO2(g)?

Two metal samples, labeled A and B, absorb the same amount of heat. Sample A has a mass of 10.0 g, and its temperature increases by 38 °C. Sample B has a mass of 20.0 g, and its temperature increases by 23 °C. Which sample has the greater specific heat capacity?

options.C: Both samples have the same specific heat capacity.
options.D: It is impossible to determine from the information given.

text: Which statement about this reaction must be correct?

options.A: If carried out in a well-insulated flask, the temperature of the reaction mixture will decrease.
options.B: It will occur spontaneously at 298 K and 1 atm pressure.
options.C: As the temperature is raised, Keq for this reaction decreases.
options.D: The reaction has more moles of products than it has moles of reactants.

text: What is the boiling point of water in a pressure cooker with a pressure of 2.00 atm? (The enthalpy of vaporization of water is 40.7 kJ mol–1.)

The gas-phase bromination of propene has a standard enthalpy of reaction of –122.5 kJ mol-(1). C3H6(g) + Br2(g) → C3H6Br2(g) ∆H° = –122.5 kJ mol-1 Substance ∆H°f, kJ mol-1 C3H6(g) 20.4 Br2(g) 30.9 What is the standard enthalpy of formation of C3H6Br2(g)?

Titanium has a normal melting point of 1668 °C and a molar enthalpy of fusion of 14.15 kJ mol-(1). The standard molar entropy of liquid titanium is 97.53 J mol-1 K-1 at 1668 °C. What is the standard molar entropy of solid titanium at this temperature?
In the reaction Cl2(g) + 3 F2(g) → 2 ClF3(g) the rate of disappearance of F2(g) is 1.0 M s-(1). What is the rate of appearance of ClF3(g)?

When the rate of the reversible reaction A + B  C is studied under a certain set of conditions, it is found that the rate of the forward reaction is kf[A]. What can be concluded about the rate law for the reverse reaction under these conditions?

options.C: The rate law of the reverse reaction cannot be determined from the information given.
options.D: An error must have been made, since if the reaction is reversible, the forward rate law must be Rate = kf[A][B].

text: A substance A decomposes irreversibly to form B. A plot of ln([A]) as a function of time from the beginning of the reaction until A is 97% consumed is a straight line with a negative slope. What is the reaction order in A?
Which statement about catalysis is correct?

options.A: If a catalyst increases the forward rate of a reaction by a factor of two, it must increase the rate of the reverse reaction by a factor of two.
options.B: If a catalyst increases the rate of formation of a product by a factor of two, it must increase the rate of formation of the mirror image of the product by a factor of two.
options.C: A catalyst must be in the same phase as the reactants and products of the reaction.
options.D: A catalyzed reaction must proceed by the same mechanism as the uncatalyzed reaction, but with a lower activation energy.

text: The isotope 226Ra has a half-life for radioactive decay of 1600 y. How long will it take the amount of 226Ra in a sample of 226RaCl2 to decrease by 25%?

When the reaction mixture stops changing, it is found that 79.0% of the H2(g) has reacted. What is the equilibrium constant for this reaction at this temperature?

What is the average oxidation state of tin in the mineral abhurite, Sn21Cl16(OH)14O6?

How much time would be required to deposit 1.00 kg of Cr using a current of 200.0 A?

Which is a possible set of quantum numbers n, l, ml, ms for a valence electron of sulfur (S)?
Which period 3 element has these successive ionization energies (in kJ mol-1)? IE1 IE2 IE3 IE4 786.5 1577.1 3231.6 4355.5 IE5 IE6 IE7 16091 19805 23780
Which is the ground-state electron configuration of gas- phase Co2+?

Which gas-phase atom releases the most energy when an electron is added to it?
The isotope 44Ti undergoes electron capture. Which daughter isotope is produced?
Which species has the strongest carbon-oxygen bond?
Which molecule has a nonzero dipole moment?
Which statement best describes the structure and bonding in nitromethane, H3C–NO2?

options.A: Each of the three bonds to nitrogen is a different length.
options.B: The molecule is Lewis acidic because the nitrogen does not obey the octet rule.
options.C: The molecule is Lewis basic because the nitrogen has a lone pair.
options.D: The nitrogen atom has a trigonal planar geometry.

text: II. It has exactly one unpaired electron.

An amine with the formula C4H11N will have which of these properties?

options.C: Absorption of light with λ > 450 nm

text: Which combination of reactants and catalyst will produce methyl propanoate, CH3CH2COOCH3, upon heating?

options.A: CH3CH2OH and CH3COOH with catalytic NaOH
options.B: CH3CH2OH and CH3COOH with catalytic H2SO4
options.C: CH3OH and CH3CH2COOH with catalytic NaOH
options.D: CH3OH and CH3CH2COOH with catalytic H2SO4
